item.title: Business Booming For Telx Interconnection and Colocation
item.description:
Despite the current economic downturn, data center provider Telx is experiencing a surge in construction at their main Chicago facility. This might seem counterintuitive during a recession, but it makes sense considering the ongoing technological transformation in business and finance. Companies have shifted from manual processes to computer-based systems, leading to a client-server model that boosted efficiency and productivity. item.title: What Makes High Frequency Trading Work
item.description:
Computerized trading, including high frequency trading, is now the norm in the stock market. As seen on CBS News, algorithms can automatically execute trades when specific conditions are met. A key challenge of automated trading is ensuring fairness by synchronizing timing for all participants. The New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) addressed this by creating a data center that standardized access time to 65 microseconds for everyone. However, this only applies to trading within the NYSE...
